Key Match Events: Cenk Tosun scored in stoppage time to send Turkey into the knockout stage with a 2-1 win over 10-man Czech Republic
Tomas Chory was shown a red card after a flare-up between players and substitutes
Antonin Barak was sent off in the 20th minute for a tactical foul
Jindrich Stanek suffered an apparent shoulder injury from his initial save and was unable to continue
Pre-Game Insights: The Czechs were chasing a goal that would have put them through at Turkey’s expense
Turkey’s Cenk Tosun said, “This is just the start. I’m delighted with my goal. We spoke about it beforehand, how this is exactly the time for it.”
Post-Match Reflections: Czech coach Ivan Hasek said of Barak, “He was sad, with his head in his hands. He really punished himself by beating himself up about it.”
Turkey’s Arda Guler was shown a yellow card
Czech forward Tomas Soucek said, “It’s disappointment. We all wanted to advance. We had a goal to beat them from the start but we didn’t make it, that’s disappointing.”
Soucek said it was “very tough” to play with a player less and he rued the goals his team conceded
Soucek added, “We all did the maximum. I have to thank all my teammates. It’s just a sad end.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Turkey finished runner-up with six points and will next face Austria in Leipzig on Tuesday
The Czech Republic finished bottom of Group F behind Georgia, which surprised group winner Portugal with a 2-0 win to progress as one of the best third-place teams
Others: The match was played at the Euro 2024 soccer tournament in Hamburg, Germany
Romanian referee Istvan Kovacs had a busy night, showing 18 yellow cards and sending off Antonin Barak
